description: Dive into "Capturing Rawai: Scenic Photo Adventures" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Capturing Rawai: Scenic Photo Adventures

places.generalDescription: Nestled between the serene Ya Nui and Nai Harn beaches, Windmill Viewpoint is a hidden gem that offers breathtaking views of the Andaman Sea. This charming spot is perfect for those seeking a peaceful sunset experience away from the crowds typically found at Promthep Cape. The iconic white windmill serves as a picturesque backdrop, making it an ideal location for photography enthusiasts. While you can visit any time of day, arriving during dusk rewards you with one of Phuket's most stunning sunsets.

sources.snippet: Here‚Äôs another viewpoint that you need to visit if you want those amazing views of Phuket‚Äì Windmill Viewpoint. It got its name from the rotor blades of the slim windmills of the area that help generate electricity for the residents of the region. It‚Äôs a small viewpoint but it has a lot of beautiful views and sceneries to offer you despite just being 3 kilometres away from Promthep Cape.

Directly in between Yanui and Nai Harn is the famous Windmill Viewpoint. If you enjoyed Promthep Cape then you‚Äôll LOVE the views from the windmill, too. As another popular sunset spot, the scenery is absolutely epic here.
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach Phuket: What You NEED to Know Before You Go

places.name: Windmill Viewpoint

reviews.text:
Windmill Viewpoint, situated between Nai Harn and Ya Nui beaches in southern Phuket, Thailand, offers panoramic vistas of the Andaman Sea and the surrounding coastline.

From this vantage point, visitors can enjoy sweeping views of Ya Nui Beach to the south, Nai Harn Beach to the north, and the nearby Koh Man island.

Unobstructed sunset views, making it a best spot for photographers and couples seeking a romantic backdrop.  The viewpoint is accessible by car or motorbike, with a small parking area available.

In summary, Windmill Viewpoint offers a tranquil setting to take in Phuket's coastal scenery, especially during sunset, and is a worthwhile stop for those exploring the island's southern region.

Moody Skies, Magical Views ‚Äì Windmill Viewpoint in the Rain

Visited Windmill Viewpoint on a slightly rainy day, and honestly, it turned out to be one of the most peaceful and beautiful moments of my trip.

Even with the overcast skies and gentle drizzle, the view was absolutely stunning. The clouds rolling over the lush green hills, the ocean shimmering in muted silver tones, and the soft breeze made the whole scene feel like a dream. There's something so calming and cinematic about standing up there in the rain, watching nature do its thing.

The spot itself is easy to reach and not too crowded (especially when the weather isn't sunny ‚Äì lucky me!). There's a quiet energy to the place, and the windmill adds a charming touch to the landscape.

If you're in Phuket and thinking of skipping this viewpoint just because it's not all sunshine and blue skies ‚Äì don't. The rain brings its own magic, and Windmill Viewpoint wears it beautifully.

Stunning view of Ya Nui and Nai Han beach. There is small building area that keep you from the sun. The way up to view point is quite steep but easy to drive up.
Small car park , around 10 cars.

places.address: Q894+VG9, Rawai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Promthep Cape, located at the southern tip of Phuket, is a picturesque lookout point renowned for its breathtaking sea views, especially during sunset. While it may be a bit challenging to access without a car, the panoramic vistas of the Andaman Sea make it worth the effort. This remote location offers a less crowded alternative to other popular spots on the island.

sources.snippet: I enjoy riding a motorcycle up the hills to take in the fresh ocean air, visiting both Promthep Cape and Windmill Viewpoint. These two iconic landmarks have become well-known locations at sunset for locals and visitors alike. Laem Krating Viewpoint, unlike nearby Promthep Cape and Windmill Viewpoint which are more famous, is one of the best-kept secrets and lesser known attractions in Rawai.

This is the first of one of the many beautiful places to watch the sunset near Rawai. The upper viewpoint brings what seems like hundreds of people every night. If you hike down below out onto Promthep Cape, you will have one-of-a-kind stunning views of the ocean!
sources.shortName: Rawai Beach Phuket: What You NEED to Know Before You Go

sources.snippet: Promthep cape ‚Äì a short taxi ride will take you to this pretty viewpoint. We went during the day and I already loved the view so I can imagine how beautiful it must be at sundown.
sources.shortName: Rawai, the Quiet Side of Phuket ‚Äì A Journey Away

places.name: Promthep Cape

reviews.text: Great spot with a beautiful view over the sea. We came in the late afternoon, and it was already getting a bit busy, especially near the viewpoint. Didn't stay long enough for sunset, but you can tell it would be a fantastic place to watch it. You can walk down towards the cliffs ‚Äì the path isn't too long, but it's steep and slippery in places, so proper shoes are a good idea. Parking was straightforward, and there are plenty of small shops nearby selling food, drinks, and souvenirs.

Promthep Cape is one of the best spots in Phuket to watch the sunset üåÖ. The view is magical, with the ocean stretching endlessly and the sky changing colors every minute. It does get a bit crowded, but honestly the atmosphere is so lively it feels part of the experience. I ended up just sitting on the rocks, enjoying the breeze and laughing at myself for trying to take 100 sunset photos when every single one already looked perfect üòÖüì∏. Truly a must-visit-sunset here is unforgettable!

Really beautiful place üòç a must visit!
Unfortunately we went on a cloudy day, so it was not really possible to view the sunset. But it was still beautiful nonetheless. If you have the opportunity, definitely come here to see the sunset!

places.address: ‡πÅ‡∏´‡∏•‡∏°‡∏û‡∏£‡∏´‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏ó‡∏û, Rawai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

sources.snippet: For anything more than that, head to the main road going west from Chalong Roundabout (the pier is due east from here). There are a few larger dive supply centers along here including Dive Supply (Google Maps location), the biggest and best with locations all around Thailand.
sources.shortName: Complete guide to scuba diving from Rawai & Chalong - Phuket

places.name: Chalong roundabout Clock Tower

reviews.text: My good mate Sir Lucas D'Anastasi knows of my absolute fandom, fetish and üéà‚ô•Ô∏è of round-abouts!  In having travelled the globe in continued search of the most perfect of circular structures, this local #Phuket one is a nicely crafted gem üíé that strategically leads one around AND about.  A gracious cheers üçª to these brilliant fine #Thai civil servants who not only created such an exceptional cyclical monument, but those assigned to keeping the rounding going!! üëç‚ù§Ô∏èü§çüíôüá®üá∑

This spot is set up as a place to catch and fine tourists for not having proper licenses. We had a valid International drivers license as a digital copy and they fined us 1000 baht anyway. We were pulled over again near Patong. You don't have to be doing anything wrong they are just monetizing tourist who are here to enjoy and stimulate the economy already. Very unwelcoming practice. They also let a pretty young tourist go unfined right behind us. Sexism at its best.
It's a very spiritual place I loved it, but you need to go on your own car/scooter, or go early, as taxis doesn't want to take you back to Bangkok, since it's not very convenient for them.

places.address: R8CR+V89, Chalong, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket 83100, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Laem Ka Beach is a hidden gem in Phuket, cherished by locals for its unspoiled natural beauty. Despite the tourism boom, this beach has remained relatively untouched, making it a peaceful retreat for those in the know. Nestled near Rawai Beach, it offers a tranquil atmosphere and is surrounded by attractions like Phuket Orchid Farm and Sea Gypsies Village.

sources.snippet: For those seeking a quieter retreat, Laem Ka Beach offers a low-key vibe perfect for relaxation. This hidden gem is often less crowded, providing a peaceful environment to soak up the sun. The only drawback is the occasional noise from speedboats transporting tourists, which does little to detract from the atmosphere.
sources.shortName: Rawai Sea Gypsy Village in Phuket

sources.snippet: In our case, a nice massage made up for the disappointment of nearby Laem Ka beach. This pretty beach turned out to be a pick-up and drop-off location for boat tours and the constant flow of tourists made it impossible to enjoy it.
sources.shortName: Rawai, the Quiet Side of Phuket ‚Äì A Journey Away

places.name: Laem Ka Beach

reviews.text:
Open Laem Ka Beach!
Back in the days, this was one of the best spots to relax. Not many tourons, mostly Thai people üëç
But at latest with the "special tourist invasions",  everything went downhill in Phuket (besides prices).
Someone closed access. There is hope as the officials are looking into it.
Let's hope someone will get justice and the public beaches ( = ALL beaches in Thailand) will be made public again ü§ûüçÄü§û

Before Covid this was one of the "last" untouched beaches... but greed has won again and the area has been blocked off by large industrial fencing and what appears to be a new condo/resort coming soon... :( The island has been overdeveloped for quite some time now so it shouldn't come as a surprise. Just sad.

Most certainly a lovely beach.
Some years ago, the sea gypsies got control of the land and erected the oppressive gate.
Prior to this, a Chinese tour company used this beach to ferry the passengers to and from the fast boats to the island.
100's at a time ruined the peace.
Open the beach, but ban the fast tour boats...

places.address: Q8HP+5RQ, Unnamed Road, Rawai, Mueang Phuket District, Phuket, Thailand

places.generalDescription: Cape Panwa is a serene and picturesque area in the southeast corner of Phuket, surrounded by lush jungle and offering a mellow bay and reef. The Khao Khad Viewpoint, located atop a hill, provides stunning panoramic views that should not be missed. Visitors can enjoy a leisurely stroll along the Cape Panwa promenade, taking in beautiful sunsets and enjoying the sea breeze.

sources.snippet: This classy caf√© is situated within the sophisticated Kantary Bay Hotel in Cape Panwa. The sea breeze and salty air make this caf√© a cool way to beat the heat of downtown Phuket!
sources.shortName: 17 Instagrammable restaurants for your sunday brunch, breakfast brunch or everyday brunch around Phuket, Thailand!

places.name: Cape Panwa

reviews.text: A good spot for evening breeze. There are also many street food vendors selling barbecue ,Thai food.

The beach is located in the south of Cape Panwa.
There are no high waves in this area even between May and October. A distinctive feature of Cape Panwa beach is the low tides, during which it becomes shallow and the rocky bottom is exposed.
In the south of the cape there are several hotels, a promenade with restaurants and private shops.
The atmosphere of the area is suitable for a relaxing holiday.
The Aquarium is located on Cape Panwa.

Quiet side of the town for those who seeks solace but with a little local zest. Daytime offers an unobstructed view of the ocean. Comes evening, catch the sunset in its absolute marvel followed by the night market scene which sees some decent local hawker fare and handcrafted items for souvenir.
